avalancheActivity.highlights: Ongoing SW snowshowers and strong winds have created windslabs widely in NW-SE facing hills. Strong N wind on Tuesday and windslabs may have formed in south facing aspects. Older snow is considered rather stable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: SW winds and snowshowers dominated last week. It got warm high in the mountains with rain early on Friday and snow melted and subsided widely then more snow was added in SW wind. Strong N wind on Tuesday and windslabs may have formed in south facing aspects. A snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll the 5th of Feb. in a NW facing aspect, revealing cold windbroken snow on top of hardpacked isothermal snow. An ice layer was between the isothermal snow and the cold windbroken snow. A rather high temperature gradient was in the top layers. Stability test showed no response.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies. Frost in all parts of the country and weknessen can grow within the snowpack the next days, becoming warmer after the weakend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers. Frost and weaknesses can grow in the snowpack.

weatherForecast.highlights: Léttskýjað og norðaustlæg eða hægbreytileg átt næstu daga, lítilsháttar snjókoma á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on Tuesday 6.2., one of them ran over the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the road Súðavíkurhlíð early on Saturday 3.2. Avalanches also fell in Súðavíkurhlíð on the evening of 30th of Jan and night before 1st of Feb.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Updated 8.2. at 13:00: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Compressions tests in the area gave a sudden collapse with medium load. Weak layers may grow even weaker in cold weather the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights:
Snow thawed up to 600m height last week. On top, new wind slabs have formed, first in SW winds, then NW-NE winds. Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area 7.2. and 8.2. confirm this and compressions tests gave a sudden collapse at 20-40 cm depth. 
Even though there is still rather little snow in mountains for the season, people travelling in steep terrain are asked to be careful. There is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches that can be dangerous for themselves, and people close by. In the cold weather the next days, weak layers might evolve even further due to a high temperature gradient in the snow and growth of facets.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies. Frost in all parts of the country and weknessen can grow within the snowpack the next days, becoming warmer after the weakend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers. Frost and weaknesses can grow in the snowpack.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hægar austlægar eða breytileg áttir næstu daga, lítil úrkoma og talsvert frost.

avalancheActivity.comment: A new slab avalanche was spotted on Tuesday morning 7.2. in a south facing gully in Bakkadalur. A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on Tuesday afternoon, 6.2. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road. A few slab avalanches were recorded early last weekend in various aspects, above Ólafsfjarðarvegur, in Dýjadalur, Tungudalur and Burstabrekkudalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New unstable wind slabs should be expected in A-S-W aspects after snowfall in NW-NE winds on Monday and Tuesday. Before, wind slabs had formed in various aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: On Monday and Tuesday, much snow was added and transported in NW-NE winds. New unstable wind slabs can have formed widely, especially in E-S-W aspects. In the storm, avalanches released in E, S and W aspects. Before, wind slabs were in various aspects after SW and variable winds. A snow pit in Skarðsdalur 7.2. showed a layered snowpack. Conpression test gave a collapse in the new snow at medium load. Deep in the snowpack was a weak layer with facets, the new year layer. In the cold weather the next days, weak layers might evolve over time due to a high temperature gradient in the snow and growth of facets. People travelling in steep terrain should be careful, as there is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies. Frost in all parts of the country and weknessen can grow within the snowpack the next days, becoming warmer after the weakend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers. Frost and weaknesses can grow in the snowpack.

weatherForecast.highlights: Fremur hægur vindur næstu daga, lítil úrkoma og talsvert frost.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs possible in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New windslabs possible in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers. High in mountains there are older windslabs that may be porly bonded with harder older snow.  In lower part of mountains older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers last week and resently N-erly snowfall or snowshowers this week. Unstable windslabs can occure in different aspects, espesially in lows and gullies. Frost in all parts of the country and weknessen can grow within the snowpack the next days, becoming warmer after the weakend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after ongoing SW snowshowers and recently after NW-NE snowshowers. Frost and weaknesses can grow in the snowpack.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðvestlæg átt svo hægvirði næstu daga, lítils háttar snjókoma á föstudag.
